result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Kraft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 10/15/2018 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect defendant IS eligible for both Challenge Incarceration Program (CIP) and Substance Abuse Program (SAP).

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $4,639.54 Joint and Several with co-actors: Jeremy Thomas 15CF46, Jacob A. Curler 15CF96 and Drevon Grant 15CF41.
-----------------------------------------

Pay court costs. If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
-----------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No contact with co-actors Jeremy Thomas, Jacob Curler and Drevon Grant. No contact with Jonah Marker. No contact with victims. 
-----------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Defendant in court in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock for bond purposes only. Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH THE VICTIMS OR THEIR RESIDENCES. NO CONTACT WITH THE CO-ACTORS.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
